meanings.definition: To push or drive with excessive force or urgency.
meanings.sent1: She overurges the door, causing it to slam loudly.
meanings.sent2: He always overurges his teammates during practice to give their best effort.
meanings.sent3: The overurging wind made the trees sway wildly in the storm.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music overurges him to practice for hours every day.
meanings.sent5: The coach's overurging voice echoed across the field, motivating the players.

meanings.definition: To strongly encourage or persuade someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher overurges her students to participate in class discussions.
meanings.sent2: Parents often overurge their children to eat their vegetables.
meanings.sent3: She overurges her friends to join her in trying out new activities.
meanings.sent4: The campaign manager overurges the voters to support their candidate.
meanings.sent5: The mentor's overurging advice helped the young entrepreneur succeed in her business.

meanings.definition: To have an intense desire or impulse to do something.
meanings.sent1: He overurges to explore the mysterious cave despite the warnings.
meanings.sent2: She overurges to travel to exotic places and experience different cultures.
meanings.sent3: The child overurges for a piece of chocolate before dinner.
meanings.sent4: His overurging curiosity led him to uncover the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The artist overurges to create a masterpiece that will inspire others.
